concise_definition: n. 一圈, 一程; v. （狗等）舔, （液体）拍打

definitions.explanation_en: One complete circuit around a track or a designated course, especially in racing or swimming.
definitions.explanation_cn: 在赛跑或游泳中，围绕赛道或指定路线完成的一整圈。
definitions.example_en: The runner completed ten laps around the track in under five minutes.
definitions.example_cn: 这名跑步者在不到五分钟内完成了十圈跑道。

definitions.explanation_en: The part of the body from the waist to the knees when sitting, especially as a surface for placing objects.
definitions.explanation_cn: 坐下时从腰部到膝盖之间的身体部位，常被用作放置物品的平台。
definitions.example_en: She placed the book gently on her lap.
definitions.example_cn: 她把书轻轻放在膝盖上。

definitions.explanation_en: To move the tongue over a surface repeatedly, typically to drink or clean something, as a dog does with water or food.
definitions.explanation_cn: 反复用舌头舔舐表面，通常指动物（如狗）舔水或食物。
definitions.example_en: The cat was lapping up the milk from the bowl.

definitions.explanation_en: To flow or move in a gentle, rhythmic manner, often describing water or waves touching a surface.
definitions.explanation_cn: 形容液体（如水或波浪）轻柔、有节奏地拍打或涌动着接触表面。
definitions.example_en: Waves were lapping against the shore as the sun set.
definitions.example_cn: 夕阳西下时，海浪轻轻拍打着海岸。

comparison.analysis: “Round”（一圈）泛指任何圆形或循环的路径，语义更宽泛，可用于非竞技场景（如绕花园走一圈）；而 “lap” 特指在固定赛道或路线上的完整一圈，多用于体育竞赛语境，具有明确的计量和竞技含义。
“Suckle”（吸吮）特指婴儿或幼崽从母亲乳房吸奶的行为，强调生理需求和亲密关系；而 “lap” 描述的是用舌头舔饮的动作，多用于动物或非哺乳场景，动作更表面、更机械，不涉及吸力。
“Ripple”（泛起涟漪）强调水面因微小扰动而产生的细小波纹，视觉上更轻柔、更静态；而 “lap” 描述的是水波持续、有节奏地拍打岸边的动作，强调动态接触和声音感，语义更贴近动作本身而非视觉效果。
